title: 111_s1118
content: INCREASE IN AMOUNT OF DEPENDENCY AND INDEMNITY COMPENSATION PAYABLE TO SURVIVING SPOUSES. Increase in dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses under title 38, United States Code. Amendments include adjusting the monthly compensation rate and ensuring no reduction or offset in benefits for eligible individuals. Effective date applies to compensation paid after 180 days from enactment of the Act. Phase-in of payment of Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for veterans who die of non-service connected disability after receiving compensation for service-connected disability rated as totally disabling for at least five years. Section 1318 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to adjust benefits for deceased veterans with continuously rated totally disabling disabilities before death. The amendment includes changes in payment rates based on the duration of the disability, ranging from 50% to 60% of benefits payable. The benefits for deceased veterans with continuously rated totally disabling disabilities before death are adjusted based on the duration of the disability, ranging from 50% to 90% of benefits payable. SEC. 3. Reducing the age limit for termination of dependency and indemnity compensation due to remarriage from 57 to 55. The age limit for termination of dependency and indemnity compensation due to remarriage is reduced from 57 to 55. The effective date of this amendment is determined by the enactment date of the Act or the start of the fiscal year. Retroactive benefits are prohibited, and individuals who remarried before the enactment date and after age 55 may be eligible for benefits under title 38, United States Code. Individuals who remarried after age 55 can be eligible for benefits under title 38, United States Code if they submit an application to the Secretary of Veterans Affairs within one year of the enactment of the Act.
